titleStmt.title: A godly and learned sermon concerning the magistrates dutie and death preached at the court, and now published for the common good, by Francis Dyllingham bachelour in diuinitie. Magnum non est præesse, magnum est prodesse. It is no great thing to rule, it is a great thing to rule well. Magnum non est vivere, magnum est piè mori. It is no great thing to liue, it is a great thing to die well.
titleStmt.author: Dillingham, Francis, d. 1625.

titleStmt.title: A godly and learned sermon concerning the magistrates dutie and death preached at the court, and now published for the common good, by Francis Dyllingham bachelour in diuinitie. Magnum non est præesse, magnum est prodesse. It is no great thing to rule, it is a great thing to rule well. Magnum non est vivere, magnum est piè mori. It is no great thing to liue, it is a great thing to die well.
titleStmt.author: Dillingham, Francis, d. 1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Legat, printer to the Vniversitie of Cambridge,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect; torn, with print missing on leaves B3 and B6.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
